data.description:
Renegade Style: Afternoon Ale
Renegade's summer session ale is a pilsner recipe fermented with an ale yeast for a light body but fruity finish.

style.name: Historical Beer
style.description: Historical Beers are any range of color. Malt sweetness will vary dramatically depending on overall balance desired. Hop bitterness is very low to very high. Above all beers in this category are reflective of an established historical beer and/or brewing heritage from any period of time or part of the world, that are not already a beer style already established in these guidelines. This beer commemorates combinations of unique brewing ingredients and/or techniques established in past periods. Examples of Historical Beers might include current day versions of historic styles which are not represented elsewhere in these guidelines, such as Finnish-style Sahti, South American Chicha, Nepalese Chong/Chang, African sorghum based beers, and others. In evaluating these beers, judges will weigh several factors such as uniqueness, heritage, regional distinction, technical brewing skills, and balance of character, background story & information and overall spirit of the intent of this category. "Historical beers" that are not represented elsewhere as a definitive style in these guidelines could possibly be entered in such categories as Experimental, Herb & Spice, Field Beer, etc. but by choice a brewer may categorize (and enter) their beer as Historical beer.

breweries.name: Renegade Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Offensively Delicious? Yes, that’s what our beer is. Always creative and always packed with flavor. This is beer for those who do the don’ts and don’t the dos, the Renegades. We don’t care about traditional styles, or following the trends, we care about making f’ing delicious beer that we are proud to serve.

Renegade was founded by Brian and Khara O’Connell in the summer of 2011 in the Santa Fe Arts District of Denver. Brian brought his offensively delicious brews, developed in his backyard, to Denverites to encourage social interaction and friendship.  Come down to our taproom, or ask for us at your favorite bar, restaurant or liquor store. Whatever you do, don’t be something you’re not.Be Renegade.

breweries.name: Alpirsbacher Klosterbräu
breweries.description:
The company was founded in 1877 by Johann Gottfried Glauner by the lion was still brewing firmierende company bought as, and thus reactivated the former monastery brewery. 1880 was the company over to Carl Albert Glauner. 1906 was renamed to Alpirsbacher Klosterbräu. The company was and is consistently in the family Glauner. The Executive Board comprises the Managing Director and Carl Markus Schlör Glauner and three new officers.

The Alpirsbacher Klosterbräu Glauner GmbH & Co.KG produces and sells beer. In addition, the company acquires and manages investments in industrial and commercial enterprises. The company, with special Alpirsbacher quality leader in Baden-Wuerttemberg export beer market. It employs 80 staff and has annual turnover of 20 million € (2007). Seat and the only production site is Alpirsbach.

A special feature of the brewery is a special pipeline , which spatially separate the brewery bottling combines.

data.name: Alpirsbacher Klosterbräu Spezial
data.description: Alpirsbacher Klosterbräu Special is a powerful abbey beer with a round, rich body and a distinctive character. Its unmistakable trademark: the very high original gravity. A malty taste reveals the original soul of our beers.

data.name: Angry Banjo
data.description: Inspired by the once popular indigenous style from Kentucky, this beer is made with American malts, flaked rice, and rye. Chocolate and Caramel malts give color and flavor to this clean, refreshing Dark Cream Ale

breweries.name: Verboten Brewing
breweries.description:
Verboten is an award-winning artisan craft brewery located in Loveland, Colorado. Our beers are an exciting mix between traditional styles and experimental brews, lovingly fretted over by our brewer, Josh Grenz. Verboten opened in 2013 and in 2014 took home two World Beer Cup medals. 

Carefully handcrafted from conception until our brew fills your glass, Verboten provides an endlessly exciting journey for craft beer lovers. Our tagline is "Beer for All," and we believe there is a perfect beer out there for everyone.

Sat: 1:00 pm - 9:00 pm
Sun: 1:00 pm - 7:00 pm

data.name: Boscos Famous Flaming Stone Beer
data.description: North America's “Original Steinbier.” Brewed using a traditional German technique, stones heated in our wood fired ovens are lowered into the beer during the brewing process, giving the beer its unique caramel character. Awarded “Three Stars” by Michael Jackson, the world’s leading beer writer. Great with salads and lightly flavored dishes.

breweries.name: Boscos Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Located in the historic Overton Square Entertainment District in Midtown Memphis, TN, Boscos believes in using only the freshest products and ingredients in our menu and in our hand-crafted beers.

Each restaurant's menu includes a variety of appetizers, salads, entrees or gourmet pizzas, baked in our brick oven. Signature items include fresh salmon baked on a cedar plank in Boscos brick oven, delicious double-cut pork chop, and a prime cut of steak cooked to perfection.

Boscos has been brewing award-winning handcrafted beers for over 22 years. That experience is evident in both the quality and variety of beers we offer, including the light-bodied, golden Famous Flaming Stone, the amber, crisp Bombay IPA, and our robust, full-bodied stouts and porters. Boscos has a beer to match everyone's tastes and to compliment every delicious dish.

breweries.name: Gordon Biersch Brewing
breweries.description: In 1997, Gordon Biersch opened a state-of-the-art brewery and bottling facility in San Jose, CA in order to begin bottling and distributing its famed, German-style beers. Today, Gordon Biersch Brewing Company is a brewing industry leader with 22 years of experience and counting. The microbrew trend continues to grow, and the company is actively expanding its distribution nationwide. Since 1998, Gordon Biersch Brewing Company has more than doubled its production, increasing its capacity to 3.1 million gallons of beer annually, making Gordon Biersch Brewing Company the largest brewery in the San Francisco Bay Area.

data.name: Chicha
data.description: We've sourced indigenous ingredients to make the most authentic interpretation possible: organic pink Peruvian pepper corns, yellow maize and organic Peruvian purple maize.  This year we also added Soursop Fruit, a native fruit to Central and South America (in our past batches of Chicha, we brewed with strawberries).

breweries.name: Dogfish Head Craft Brewery
breweries.description: Dogfish Head Craft Brewery makes off-centered ales for off-centered people.  Since 1995, Dogfish has brewed with nonstandard ingredients such as raisins, chicory, maple syrup, and grapes, changing the way people think about beer.  Dogfish believes beer can have as much flavor, complexity, diversity, food-compatibility and ageability as the world's finest wines.  To discover your favorite off-centered ale, visit www.dogfish.com

breweries.name: Empyrean Brewing Company
breweries.description: It began with a dream that we could brew full-flavored beer in the great state of Nebraska. In late 1990 that dream became our state’s first brewpub, Lazlo’s Brewery & Grill. Since then demand for our beer has grown, so we expanded our pub and Empyrean Brewing Company was born. Today we still dream big even while we hand craft our beers in small flavor–filled batches. So enjoy an Empyrean beer, the taste of dreams come true.

data.name: Finnish Sahti - Farmhouse Ale
data.description:
The flavor profile is interesting and very complex due to the unique ingredients that go into it.

Primarily among these is the juniper, which lends a pinous, “Christmas-y” flavor to the ale, which is somewhat reminiscent of hops, and helps balance out any residual sweetness from the malts.

A juniper-infused ale with no hops that is not boiled.

The second primary flavor contributor to sahti is the yeast. It is brewed simply with Finnish baking yeast. It’s very unique, and certainly is a powerful fermenter, shredding through sugars like it’s nothing. 

The lauder tun is a hollowed white birch log called a “kuurna”, the mash is ladled over the juniper branches and hay, then drained into a creamer container, just like they did in the dark-ages before steam and metal were used in the brewing process.

data.name: Gilde Lüttje Lagen
data.description:
Lüttje documents is the most traditional draft beer, specialty and unique in Hanover Germany.

The Lüttje-ply drinking is a centuries-old tradition and to this day an enjoyable fun on shooters, sports and festivals, and wherever friends gather at the pub or the game of Skat.

data.name: Golden Revolution
data.description:
Back in May of 2006, Sam Calagione visited the Herold Brewery in Prague to brew an adaptation of our Golden Shower - known as Golden Revolution.

Golden Revolution is an Imperial Pilsner Sam and Pivovar Herold Bfieznice brewers came up with using traditional Czech brewing techniques, local ingredients, and spring water from Herold's castle grounds to create what is quite possibly the first high alcohol, dry-hopped monster beer from Eastern Europe.

Pivovar Herold's Golden Revolution was available in the United States exclusively through Michael Jackson's Rare Beer Club as the November 2006 featured selection.

data.name: Imperial Nut Brown Ale
data.description: Originally brewed to celebrate the 10th anniversary of Tommyknocker Brewery, this special brew is meticulously crafted with pure maple syrup and the highest quality chocolate and crystal malts, and is accented with a rich blend of American hops.

breweries.name: Tommyknocker Brewery
breweries.description:
For over 20 years, we've used pure Rocky Mountain snow melt, the finest malted barley and high quality hops to passionately craft award winning ales and lagers. With over 100 medals to our name, one sip of a time-proven classic or an innovative new recipe and you too will become part of the loyal and expanding TKB following.
 
Nestled in the cozy historic mountain mining town of Idaho Springs, Colorado, we're just 30 miles west of Denver and 20 miles east of Summit Co. That makes us the perfect destination to sit by the fireplace for a wintertime warm up or cool down in the summer with a refreshing brew and award winning pub fare.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Mon-Sat 11:00am- 2:00am
Sun 11:00am-12:00am

data.name: Isabelle Proximus
data.description: The collaborative beer was the work of five brewers - Sam Calagione (Dogfish), Tomme Arthur (The Lost Abbey), Adam Avery (Avery Brewing), Rob Todd (Allagash), and Vinnie Cirulzo (Russian River). The guys all took a trip to Belgium together a few years back and decided to make a beer together - this is it. The beer was brewed at Tomme's brewery and each company put in a few barrels of beer and some of their house yeast. The result is a tasty sour ale. The original label artwork was painstakingly painted by Sam Calagione.

data.name: L'Erabière
data.description: Just like beer, maple syrup is the cumination of ancestral practices. This maple beer is the pleasant result of a harmonious association of the two traditions. Brewed with maple syrup, this beer is a flavorful mix of fruit, maple and the finest hops. Delicaye in mouth, its woody attack gradually gives way to a smooth caramel and malt finish.

breweries.name: Ferme brasserie Schoune
breweries.description:
Belgian farm brewery, one of, if not the first in Canada. The owner, Patrice Schoune, is from a long line of Belgian farmers and second generation established in Canada. 

Their beer recipes naturally use in their vast majority products directly issued from his farm (barley, wheat, oat and hop).Patrice reestablished the ancient technique of floormatting to create his malt out of his own barely production. In 2002, he reintroduced the Fuggle hop which had disappeared since the 40’s in Canada and is now integrated in his recipes. These elements are part of the uniqueness of the Farm Brewery Schoune.

Today still very attached to the flavours and tastes excellence and the love of the product from its conception up to its production and finally distribution of his artisanal beers, the 300 hectares Farm Brewery Schoune is a regional as well world reference for the quality and originality of its products. 

Farm Brewery Schoune exports under the name of O’Canada.

data.name: La Rubia
data.description: La Rubia is the lightest beer we brew.  However, this beer does not lack in flavor.  It has a nice crisp bitterness to it with a slight bready and sweet flavor. This beer is brewed for the beautiful hot weather we get here in Miami.   La Rubia is a combinaion of German Pilsner Malts, British Crystal Malts, Czech Saaz Hops and German Ale Yeast.  Making this beer a true American Blonde Ale.

breweries.name: Wynwood Brewing Company
breweries.description: Wynwood Brewing Company is Miami’s first craft production brewery in the heart of Wynwood Art District, featuring a tap room. We are family owned and operated with the simple objective of bringing fresh, delicious, and creative beers to thirsty South Floridians and tourists alike. We operate a 15-barrel brewhouse and distribute our blond ale, IPA, Porter, barrel aged Strong Ales and seasonal offerings.

data.name: Limb & Life
data.description:
This is one of two collaborative brews we made at the Sierra Nevada Brewing Company in September, 2009.

Limb & Life is a 'small' beer, made from the second runnings of the larger brew, Life & Limb. Limb & Life has a roasted malt flavor reminiscent of dark roasted coffee and toasted bread, combined with a pronounced hoppiness from the use of bold and aromatic American hops.

Limb & Life is an easy drinking 'session' beer - an antidote to the heavy sippers, and a beer that begs for another glass. It is balanced yet flavorful, hoppy yet not without strong malt, and drinkable but still complex.Limb & Life will be an extrememly limited draft-only release.

data.name: Monks' Dark Ale
data.description: Monks’ Dark Ale is a well-balanced medium bodied ale with a smooth creamy mouthfeel, good carbonation, and no alcohol warmth or astringency.  The aromas are predominantly hazelnut and chocolate with hints of raisins and stone fruits, with no diacetyl evident.  This ale pours with nice lacing and a lasting tan head.  Flavors include toasted hazelnuts, raisins, caramel malt, and mild green apples. No phenols are evident.  The subdued, yet present hops create a light, crisp, refreshing, taste.  The finish is dry with mild caramel and green apples and a slight roastiness, inviting another sip of this all-season dark signature ale.
data.foodPairings: Monks’ Dark Ale pairs well with any chili based foods, hearty stews, or any roasted or barbecued beef or poultry. It is a wonderful compliment to cheesecake for desert.

breweries.description:
Abbey Brewing Company, located in Abiquiu, New Mexico, is the producer of Monks' Ales starting with Monks' Ale released in 2005.

The brewery is located on the grounds of the Benedictine Monastery of Christ in the Desert.  The monks do not allow visits to the brewery.

data.name: MudSlinger
data.description: This dark and hoppy creation is our most unique.  The Mudslinger is dark and chocolatey but with a bright herbal hoppy character.  The large amount of oats used adds a rich cookie character and a big, soft mouthfeel.

breweries.description: McHale's Brewhouse is a Scotch-Irish Pub with an attached nanobrewery. We have amazing food. We make our own beer batter from our Dixie Blonde. We have 5-8 rotating house beers on tap at all times.

data.name: Nora
data.description: She refers to the ancient history of nomads and pyramids of spices and Kamut ® Khorasan that in the Egyptian language meaning "soul of the earth." Its warm color, orange amber, was covered with an abundant foam that releases notes of oriental aromas, ginger and citrus.

breweries.name: Birrificia Le Baladin
breweries.description: It is the place where it all started. There would be much to say and tell it to start back over the key dates. In 1986, Teo decides, with his partner then Michelle, a pretty young French dancer, to open in Piozzo, a small town unknown to the door of the Langhe where he was born, a "creperie"! He rents a former "tavern" with an attached mini apartment on the top floor and a gravel courtyard on the back and opens its doors. At first, his passion for beer, and a little 'light his aversion for wine led him to fill the menu with more than two hundred references international beers, as well as dainties to enjoy to work alongside the crepes. Gradually, the goodness of the choices made ​​good name and port customers to small local baptized "Le Baladin" by his friend François of CIRQUE BIDON in homage to the nature of Teo same. Years went by and the room expands, you change, you will see a big circus tent to cover the courtyard paved with gravel now tables and chairs in style "Oktoberfest" and hand in hand also changes his mentor: Nora is now its new companion and muse together and decide a new course of the local : transform the creperie in a brewpub! After months of study and travel with Nora to discover Belgian brewers have our hero returns with huge bins loaded onto a van Volkswagen Westfalia and places them in the garage of the ousted former owner of the house, adjacent to the restaurant, now transformed into a microbrewery. So begins the adventure productive BEER BALADIN that sees just two beers "taxes" to the regulars who frequent the pub goers somewhat perplexed and embarrassed to taste these first, honestly a bit 'adventurous productions Teo. Over time, the production will be moved to other places for sizing issues and logistics, but still the aura of magic that permeated the early days of the brewery remains unchanged. Today, large kitchen has taken the place of the production and in the pub beers are on tap now classic carnet baladiniano as well as all production in the bottle. Occasionally a few small tweaks gives customers reason of surprise and veiled "Amarcord" in which one of them remembers the beginnings of this place, now a destination for "pilgrimage" by many fans of the beer world. It is always a place where good food is accompanied not only by our beers but by good music and by the sympathy of the staff who always has a smile for everyone and where it is customary to a friendly "welcome", a hello and a good day to all those who pass through it if only for a small beer refreshing.

data.name: Popping Off
data.description: A Dampfbier (German for Steam Beer) style ale, Popping Off is an all-barley ale, fermented at high temperatures with Bavarian Weissbier yeast which gives it a slightly phenolic aftertaste. It is medium-bodied, mildly hopped, low in carbonation and incredibly easy to enjoy.

breweries.description: German-inspired beer and cuisine crafted with our city’s heritage of greatness in mind.

data.name: Sage Gruit
data.description: Sensuously alluring, mysteriously seductive as filtered light on a forest floor. Sage, turmeric, yarrow, flower, lemon, grass, and lotus root populate the world of this delicate and yet powerful flaxen brew.

breweries.name: Solarc Brewing
breweries.description: Solarc Brewing is a craft beer co. based out of Los Angeles CA.  Started by two avant-garde artists and crafty tinkerers Archie Carey and Saul Alpert Abrams make small batch specialty beers that experiment with alternative ingredients while still keeping a well balanced strong drinkable brew.

data.name: Saint Saltan
data.description: Gose (proounced go-za or goes-ah) is a traditional German style lager beer not often brewed.  The beer is crisp, light and refreshing with plenty of flavor.  The addition of salt and coriander help to mimic water high in zinc that contributes to the flavor profile in the form of a mineral taste.  The beer is soured slightly for added mouthfeel and depth.

breweries.name: Magic Hat Brewing Company
breweries.description: The Saturnalian Saga of Magic Hat began in 1994 when our first batch of beer was brewed in a funky little space on Flynn Avenue, in Burlington, Vermont.  Dozens of beers and a brewery later, the Vermont brewery finds itself reaching more than 30 states with its unique take on classic styles.  Magic Hat continues to be a leader in craft beer and is currently the only craft brewer putting a performance in every bottle.

style.name: Historical Beer
style.description: Historical Beers are any range of color. Malt sweetness will vary dramatically depending on overall balance desired. Hop bitterness is very low to very high. Above all beers in this category are reflective of an established historical beer and/or brewing heritage from any period of time or part of the world, that are not already a beer style already established in these guidelines. This beer commemorates combinations of unique brewing ingredients and/or techniques established in past periods. Examples of Historical Beers might include current day versions of historic styles which are not represented elsewhere in these guidelines, such as Finnish-style Sahti, South American Chicha, Nepalese Chong/Chang, African sorghum based beers, and others. In evaluating these beers, judges will weigh several factors such as uniqueness, heritage, regional distinction, technical brewing skills, and balance of character, background story & information and overall spirit of the intent of this category. "Historical beers" that are not represented elsewhere as a definitive style in these guidelines could possibly be entered in such categories as Experimental, Herb & Spice, Field Beer, etc. but by choice a brewer may categorize (and enter) their beer as Historical beer.

data.name: Sème ta Graine
data.description:
This beer was created on July 13th, 2006.

It is composed of seven varieties of cereals and 1 variety of hop.

Big winner, it was voted best blonde ale beer at the “Beer and Flavour Feast” held from September 1st to September 4th 2006.

breweries.name: Barley Island Brewing Company
breweries.description: Barley Island’s national award winning handcrafted ales produced on-premise with only the finest malts and hops. Being independently owned and operated has its advantages. We can quickly implement new food trends or even beer flavors to suit our local clientele.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Monday - Thursday: 11 am - 12 am
Sunday: 12 pm - 12 am
Friday - Saturday: 11 am - 1 am

data.name: Sjoes
data.description: Gulpener Sjoes, who wants to taste the real Limburg. The combination of our classic Pilsner and Oud Bruin is Gulpener Sjoes. A beer like the perfect blend. A little bitter to keep you sharp and sweet aftertaste for even more fun. That makes our Sjoes the favorite of our region. Really Limburg!
data.foodPairings: Hearty, spicy meals and dishes with slightly sweet taste.

data.name: The Catalyst
data.description:
In 1850, A German Immigrant named Antone Miller arrived by Steamboat in a booming little Gold Rush town built at the confluence of the American and Sacramento Rivers. Here he set out to build the Union Brewery - which would quickly grow to be one of the largest, most prolific breweries in the Region. 

Sadly, ten years later a fire claimed the brewery beyond repair. Lucky for us his famous Steam-beer recipe didn't burn up with it! On a history binge at the city archives one afternoon, we stumbled upon this historic recipe and set out to brew it once again. 

With a bright, earthy flavor from Sacramento native Cluster hops and a slightly sweet, nutty character from roasted barley, we think you'll love this little trip through history!
data.foodPairings: Hearty, rich foods like Texas-style chili, barbecue, pulled pork sandwiches, etc.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

breweries.name: Sactown Union Brewery
breweries.description: Sactown Union Brewery is a Production Brewery with a Tasting Room located in East Sacramento, CA (just three short blocks from Sac State!). We are community oriented, and celebrate history's social catalysts - those that bucked the status quo to make the world around them a better place! "We're not just brewing Beer; We're brewing Community."

breweries.name: Warsteiner Brauerei
breweries.description: The Warsteiner Brewery was founded in 1753, and today is one of the largest privately held breweries in Germany. Its flagship is the Warsteiner brand, one of Germany’s leading premium pilsener brands.
